page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA BRIDGE
page.content: Our Domesday Block is a rural area. It is typical chalk Downland with three dry valleys as well as the valley of the River Nailbourne. It consists mainly of agricultural land rising gently from the Nailbourne Valley. The three villages Bridge, Patrixbourne and Bekesbourne are situated in the Nailbourne Valley. The Nailbourne is an intermittent chalk stream. At present it is flowing from the lake in Bourne Park which is fed by springs but is dry higher up. There are seven farms wholly or partly within the area.The traditional Kentish crops of apples and hops are grown.About one third of the block is covered with orchards growing apples, pears and plums. The landscape is very beautiful with many trees and belts of woodland to add interest to the local views.
